hoHyM4L-6lhG0wHWJqLc8w.review_text: Not bad. Decent selection on drinks.  Their food seems promising.  would love to try if I was in the neighborhood.

GWwiM-qbmAEEPZmlxJRmKw.review_text: I can easily say that this was the worst meal of my life. We walked in knowing that it was a bar, however when we opened the door and stepped in it looked more like a dungeon; dark and dismal. We were told by our hotel concierge, that this was the place to go for steak and barbecued ribs. They said it was like southern barbecue. So of course we decided to trust our concierge.  Big mistake!!!  The server was attentive at times, at others, she was doing homework on the bar and it was hard to get her attention. The drinks were weak and overpriced.  The food was horrible, starting with the deviled eggs that had a runny filling and tasted like pure mayonnaise. Then the barbecue sauce was like water and tasted horrible, all three different mixes that they dared to call southern. Southern my a@&!!  Of course the menu didn't even have steak and the ribs ended up being smoked, which the waiter neglected to tell us. The ribs were overcooked and left an after taste from the horrible barbecue sauce. We took one look at the baked beans and said no way. The coleslaw was purple and also had way too much mayonnaise. The potato salad had so much mayonnaise it was uneatable. We ended up paying eighty dollars for one drink, a beer, one appetizer and two entrees. Paying that money for the worst meal of our lives was extremely painful. It was seven o'clock on a Monday night and they had one other patron at the bar. This place failed in so many ways.  I wrote this review so I save anybody from going into there to eat. Turn back, do not eat there!!!

NmIOrfB-C5DmMDefL9bx4w.review_text: I went here when they weren't serving food, so just the bar was open. It was alright.

QVeKGhOxb0e77prfXoSglw.review_text: Super noisy and ultra bad service. The hostess had to be hunted down and she waa dismissive, none of the tables has been served food and the bartender seemed to have aspergers. Avoid, they will be out of business and a hopefully better place will replace them.

obngExh1FThF6tzULWf3Sw.review_text: First off, the space is really cool. Exposed brick, dark wood everywhere, metal accents, and huge mirrors give it a stunning yet rustic old school saloon vibe. It's huge, which is a plus in San Francisco where most bars hold 50 people tops in a long narrow space. I've been a number of times with big groups of friends and it accommodated us all perfectly.   Tip: Reserve the private lounge if you've got a party- you still have access to both the tap room bar and the main dining room bar, but you get your own space.  Sooo... the drinks are delicious, and as a whiskey drinker, I've been enjoying their crazy selection of ryes (uh huh, like their name). Their Maple Rye Old Fashion is a must try, as is the American Julep, or go classic Manhattan and you won't be disappointed either. I'm sure drinks without whiskey are good too... but I wouldn't be the one to ask about those.   As any good BBQ place does, they sell out of the ribs and brisket towards the end of the night so get there on the earlier side. This isn't one of those places that just reheats their meat and hides the dryness by slathering on more sauce, this is the real deal. Smoked in house. Add on the mac and cheese, fried pickles, and deviled eggs? Um yep. Do it. So good.   Overall: if you haven't checked it out since the grand opening, you should.

AV6n2IFxNHQ2lu7ZONOomw.review_text: Always on the lookout for good BBQ spots in the city, Bitters Bock & Rye was something we had been looking forward to trying, especially since we saw that they were open late. We made our way over to Nob Hill around 10pm and were seated immediately in the back room with the bar.   I expected great things from the bbq meats but they turned out to just be average. I have definitely had better from other local bbq spots. What I wasn't expecting was to have one of the best cocktails and the best cornbread around. The maple rye old fashioned with bacon was so good that I want to learn how to make it at home. The cornbread was also amazing with a great taste, a nice crust and just the right consistency.   Overall, I would come back here, but it would not be for the bbq. Try that drink because it is amazing. "I'm a fan."

xdjhKDIy9AMCqxebBv69nw.review_text: They have WiFi and a baked sweet potato to die for plus the kitchen is open until 1am!!  And as if all that wasn't enough its on Polk and Post a half block from home!!  Winning!! BBQ and free WiFi until 1am

vfZFqMSgtlRIwg2ITGmn9Q.review_text: My friend and I were wandering around Polk St. a little buzzed up on a Sunday afternoon after watching some football and he decided we should pop in here to try the food. I live about 4 blocks away and didn't even know they had food! The interior is nice and the place seemed clean, and they had football on the TVs.   We were served promptly by a nice young girl, looked over the menu and everything sounded pretty good, especially for bar food! It was all comfort type food- greasy, fried, full of carbs and tasty sounding. We ended up with the fried pickles and the fries topped with pulled pork. I don't even like Pickles and I devoured them! They were seriously amazing. They were out of regular fries for the fry dish so we got sweet potato fries and I think that actually made them better! They also bring you an assortment of 4 different styles of bbq sauce. I'm big on bbq sauce so I was a happy camper, the mustard and midwest were my favorite! My friend got an Anchor Steam and I got an old fashioned- which had bacon on the rim. It wasn't bad, the bacon just threw me off a little, I guess I don't see the appeal there. But the drink was nice and strong the way I like it.  Altogether a pretty good experience, if you're in the area and want some tasty bar food I recommend it!

JSPE5bMOg6rAKvKVEdfIXw.review_text: New BBQ in the Polk/Tendo was just what I needed! SF doesn't have enough BBQ places to start - the fact that is is essentially inside a bar makes it highly likely that I will be returning, often.  We stuck with the BBQ plates over the sandwiches. The chicken was fantastic, surprisingly tender and moist and good flavor. Ribs were not as tender, fall-off-the-bone as I would have liked, but still tasted wonderful. As for the brisket, good, but it got cold super fast and I think it took away from the flavor. Mac-n-cheese and onion fries were the best staples. Baked beans were not your usual baked beans - not super sweet, exactly how I like baked beans. Slaw was unique twist, not saying it's the best slaw out there.  Heads up to anyone trying this place for the first time...it's a bar, really. Not a restaurant. Service is going to be very informal and sometimes it will take awhile to get a drink refill, but the waiters are cool and at least will check on you.

yAShjBoCrqM1SYn8epuSJg.review_text: Protip: the bar is very hard to spot. Despite the even number in its address (1122), the entrance is on Polk's west side (go figure!). On top of that there's currently no big "Bitters, Bock and Rye" sign to guide you.  I went there on a Saturday night for a friend's farewell party. I arrived around 9pm. Food was still being served. The ribs, pulled pork burgers or parmesan macaroni that I saw around made me regret my earlier dinner. I sure wish I had room for some of these.  Now to the drinks part. I tried: * the American Julep, a honey whiskey based cocktail. Delicious, with a touch of mint. 5 stars. $8 * the Ginger Strawberry lemonade, based on a strawberry Skyy vodka. Very refreshing, fruity. 5 stars. $9 * the Bitter Truth, full of Bourbon, rye and definitely more on the bitter side. Duh. Comes in a martini-style glass. 4 stars. $10 * a standard Gin Tonic. For $6, it was a strong-ass drink. Almost too much actually. 3 stars.  So overall the drinks are pretty solid. Order shots and you won't be disappointed either: they fill them to the very top. Waiters and barman were really cool. Bouncer wasn't (I went outside to take fresh air for a bit, and was forced to negotiate that he let me in to close my tap).  I really like the vibe of the place. Sorta dive bar with a classy touch. I'm into it! Definitely going to be back in the future, and looking forward to see how the place looks like once they're all done with decoration and final touches.

AsSn6xVwHLCRJcTKOLw5EA.review_text: I came with a large group for a birthday dinner on a Saturday night. We sat at a large wooded slab table, which was pretty cool. The vibe is casual and laid back. There are plenty of tables to sit and a large bar area as well. The whole restaurant is actually split into two, but connected by a short hallway. Service was pretty good, but with 15+ people ordering, it would've been nice if they knew who ordered what instead of showing up with the food and shouting it out.  I split the combo meal with my SIL (we didn't get full, was ok). We ordered:  Brisket (lean) - fatty was sold out. It was definitely lean... jerky like. The seasoning was good though. Smoked ribs - it had a nice char on it, but still dry. Again, I thought the taste was good, but it was too much work to get the meat off the bone. Pulled pork - not pulled at all. More like cubed chunks and not tender at all. Sweet potato fries - really good! They're baked with a sprinkle of salt. Simply and delicious! Mac n Cheese - mushy and wasn't too cheesy since I tried it lukewarm. Shrimp & grits - I took a bite of the grits and it was bland and watery. BBR (?) BBQ Sauce - yummy!! Really liked this BBQ sauce. Better than the Texas BBQ one. Gretzer (?) cocktail - really good! I had two.  Overall, great place to grab drinks and the bonus is you can order off a full BBQ menu. I was able to order half a rack at 1a! However, I wished the texture of the BBQ was more to my liking. It seemed too tough, but the flavor is pretty good. Halfway there!!

WwmWdDCJREohcxQqfnOL-A.review_text: Love this place! The bar area is more lively than the restaurant section on Fridays and weekends but it's nice to have the option of a quieter setting.  Must haves: fried okra, guilty fries, brisket, ribs  Service was lovely but the music was ridiculously loud for no reason (people weren't dancing) so I had to shout to have a conversation. Crowd wasn't very diverse but  that's more and more the case in SF these days.  If you love BBQ and want a nice place to get a drink or watch a game, this is the place to be.

BWcdAjh5bkLcdwOeQHR0PQ.review_text: What an awesome spot! I planned a party for 30+ people and reserved the back restaurant with a huge wooden dining table. It was well-lit (not too dark), and the music was decent. We all had enough space for guests to sit/move around and mingle. The manager Shannon is so accommodating and the rest of the staff was really great as well. Lots of people ordered food and it was a very easy place to go to to catch up with friends over cocktails!

FiHXzEXrQpePOtgz_h71pA.review_text: Honestly the best group of female bartenders in the city! These ladies are handelig the crazy Giants crowd with a smile and lots of energy. They put the girls at Momo's to shame! So glad they are in ny neighborhood. Ive been here several times and consitantly the service is great over and over. They love what they are doing and love the food and drinks they are serving. Thanks for making up for my recent bad  service around the city ladies!

dYgcrxIi38eJh53NddnFYQ.review_text: There are several sections to hang out in Bitters, each with their own bar. I wandered around from room to room for a while looking for my group, awkwardly staring at people because I left my glasses in the car, and this place is dimly lit. lol.  There's TVs playing sports, but there is music playing over it. I don't know if Fridays are 90s nights, or if they just play old music all the time. Either way, it was a nice trip down memory lane.  I only had 1 drink while here, and I tried to get the most unique thing on the menu. Enter the Maple Rye Old Fashioned, whiskey with an orange twist, a hint of maple syrup, and BACON ON THE RIM. Yes, that's right, small bacon pieces on the rim. There are several sensations you get when smelling this because you get a little bit of bacon, a strong scent of whiskey, and also some kind of bitters or something that really threw me off. Overall the scent was pretty potent, and a little overwhelming, but not so much that I wouldn't drink it. I mean come on, I'm going to finish it. lol. Overall it wasn't a bad drink, and definitely something I'm glad I tried.  In addition to the 90s music, dim lighting, and bacon whiskey, there were waitresses here giving out shots and t-shirts. Thanks.   There is a $20-$25 minimum to use a credit card, but luckily the server let me use mine anyways when I hadn't spent enough. Thanks again!

mAA3D6Wgg_7-Gboo1ATCFg.review_text: the BBQ is a bit inconsistent, we have been many times, and as advertised, they do sell out, but when the brisket and ribs are presented, they are worth the wait.  Do not hesitate when considering the beans; mmmm. Both bars are fun but the restaurant bar is very accessible and fun to view Giants games!!!

ECLO9ACvtykvxXOJsDV7iQ.review_text: Great food, great drinks! Fun place to go to meet up with friends

RPvdEqvcfL59SiFhqujdqw.review_text: I made a reservation for a large group here on a Friday night. We reserved the "Viking table" for 16 people, but ended up having a few more guests than expected. The staff at Bitters Bock & Rye went above and beyond to accommodate us, bringing over extra tables and chairs to put on the end of our already outrageous table to make sure everyone could be seated together. The food arrived very quickly (much appreciated since some of us needed to head out early to catch a show) and everything was delicious.   I had the sliced brisket sandwich with fries, and though it was a little tough to eat as a sandwich, I enjoyed it simply as brisket with a roll on the side =) The fries were great as well, and I loved the house BBQ sauce.  Thanks again to BBR for being gracious hosts to our somewhat rowdy and unorganized group. We had a lovely time!

G3UN8JtgbvfXCHgfGU114w.review_text: As a small-town Texan, it's hard to find BBQ in SF that makes the grade - but for ambiance, drinks, and the right mix of down-home and high-quality, Bitters is an excellent choice.  Wait staff is friendly and proud of the joint.  Definite recommendation.

xflDsk7xp1tBa3djOzTiqQ.review_text: Came here one night and left right away. The bar was a bit busy, but we found an empty table to the side. It had only one chair, and the other was taken by these other people even though they weren't using it. We asked, but it turned out they were saving it. The waitress bypassed us twice, and didn't seem to care that our table only had one chair, yet we were a party of two. So, we just decided to leave.

AIjA_jJQyAhoxtYd335Ekg.review_text: Holy maze, Batman!  Was touring with some SantaCon peeps this past weekend, and stopped by here for a drink.  They had a home bar cocktail list, plenty on tap, and some food specials.  The bar seems initially small.  It was only after exchanging several texts with people we were trying to meet up with that we realized there are several (maybe only 2, maybe 15) bars here, and you can seemingly just walk through doorways and around corners to find another one.    It was small, hot, and crowded with Santas.  Drinks were pricey, food looked decent.  Staff saved the day.  A bunch of pros with great attitudes despite the crowds.  A good place.  Would love to go back when it's not so Santa-tastic to get a better feel for the place.  Bigger tables, good bar space.  Nice place to hang.

VjJ1kSBO79Go2rCFa32rAw.review_text: Heidi is a great bartender! The fried pickled green beans are amazing and the happy hour is great - ask for the bartenders choice beer. Great atmosphere and friendly staff - you should come here for the great food, service, and staff!!!

n1BT4UjV0SMfMwCpkQwNLw.review_text: Great ambiance but questionable bar tenders. I planned my Bfs birthday at bbr, during the process the staff was very helpful and willing to accommodate special requests. Unfortunately a couple of the bar tenders were a big unfriendly and reluctant to make me a mint julep because they had to many orders and preferred I ordered something more simple. This left a bit of a sour taste in my mouth but I can't deny the great service on the behalf of others.

xBcNPTcCigOS4We-4ZIHqw.review_text: Randomly ended up here with a friend one night and it was the best decision of the night. Inside is so charming, intimate, the service was friendly, fast and the bartender was very knowledgeable and helpful about the menu.   I'm always looking for bars that have awesome cocktails, especially if its whisky. This place has all kinds of cocktails, we tried four and they were all top notch. For me the best was the Maple Bacon Old Fashioned. Absolutely genius! It was a little jarring at first, but after I got over that, I detected all the layers of flavor. The saltiness of the bacon, the sweetness of the maple,  the punch of the whisky. I loved it! Bitters Bock and Rye will be my go to bar around Polk from now on and I highly reccomend it to anyone in the area.

4QplxPyj5jkPLCl2yLqyuQ.review_text: Come here if you like bourbon, bbq, and craft beers. As has been said before - the Brisket here is top notch, whether you get it in its entree or sandwich formats.  I'm also a fan of the fried okra appetizer (what is that dip?), and the Maple Rye Old Fashioned cocktail (mmm... bacon-rimmed).  Also come here if you like places that get a little bit rowdy for sports (college football, Giants, and 49ers in particular).

MCm2nJs2tO0Hy_h1enIAQA.review_text: Shannon's new digs! Friendliest staff, best cocktails on the menu as well as off, awesome southern food menu- as long as you're there before 11.

VgtcRwMPiAEeuPsayXB4kA.review_text: Had some Scottish ale and some nice fried pickles. Need to come back to try the other food!

MEK-ph4hs8mfDplglk_RcQ.review_text: Didn't know what to think when we stepped into this dark little bar, but went on the recommendation of the bartender at the Lush Lounge.  Wow.  The food was amazing. Fried okra was so good.  Ribs were smokey perfection - seriously some of the best ribs I've ever had.  Really good burger with great fries.  Drinks were all good from bourbon to tequila to vodka.  Bartender knew what he was doing.  I'd go back in a heartbeat.

O_0yNszoWjH3oZ0J5DZEXA.review_text: On Halloween, the manager with a beard there randomly punched my friend, all because he didn't see him at the door and walked past him, and gave him a little lip when the manager aggressively grabbed him. The manager then dove into him to tackle him, while taking out this cute little girl, and she got really hurt. He then started punching my friend while ontop of him. This guy is a nutcase and will soon be charged with assault.  The food is terrible here too.

TknGTatZq_ABSuiNjuR0Gg.review_text: The food here is pretty good, definitely be ready for a heavier meal (not the place to come looking for a salad or light bite). They almost always have reservations and are great for groups. They standardly have about 4 different BBQ sauces on the table (the BBR one is the best) they are all good and add to the meal. I would highly recommend the Devild Eggs (they seem to be popping up everywhere but are good here). The pulled pork sandwich was also good and worth a shot!   The best part of the meal... MAPLE BACON OLD FASHIONED! If you like whiskey and bacon, you need this drink... I will probably go back just for that on a regular basis, and maybe have some BBQ on the side.

v0ANF5-KxIWBtQQB0PfI4w.review_text: I couldn't believe Noel M when she told me she found a bar that serves great drinks and BBQ.  Seriously, I thought she could only imagine such a place.  Then she proved it existed.  Favorites: the brisket sandwich, the blue crab hush puppies, the Cajun chips, the tender burger, their refreshing mint julep, and their strong old fashion (whiskey + bacon = yum).  The service has been friendly and the cocktails and food have yet to disappoint.   They are also working on providing Sunday Brunch which I am impatiently waiting for.  If their bar menu is this good I can't wait to try their Brunch.

rodcjjeFRhI0RLgWEFcMpQ.review_text: This place was a flop. My boyfriend and I were having a nice night in the city and I wanted fried pickles so we decided to check it out. My boyfriend is a craft brewer and noticed the bar was carrying a beer his company had made that had been expired for three months. He ordered the most bland chicken sandwich I have ever tasted. I thought I was ordering sweet potato fries with tasty pork but I received an over baked sweet potato covered in fatty bacon bits and sour cream. It was not appetizing to say the least and the frickles were mediocre. The service was ok and the ambiance was cool but we will definitely never go back. In San Francisco, delicious and creative food is expected- Bottom Rock Rye just doesn't get it.

STHGUd9RwtYTE4M06IcLoA.review_text: Sunday lunch at the bar....brisket sandwich chopped salad and tequila Delicious.....nice atmosphere An excellent find for the neighborhood  Nuff said

ZzbtEALaj_Goxx2uV0OMiQ.review_text: A good business fills a need.. But a great business fuels a passion! And my passion for great food is always fueled whenever I visit this awesome place on Polk!  From the initial warm greet to the attention to detail for every drink pour (even the beers) to ultimately the exceptional BBQ pairing with the choice of house-made sauces, Bitters delivers the entire package to the avid food Connoisseur and the novice alike!   Every plate is great and the best part is that you know that love and care went into every menu selection as soon as the plate lands in front of you. You want bar food, go to Kennedy's. You want BBQ w a great drink to chase it down, you only go to Bitters!  My suggestion? Ask for burnt ends on the Mac n Cheese when you're craving that late night goodness...not only does it beat the questionable burrito around the corner in taste, quality and satisfaction by a long shot but it also gets you ready for an awesome night sleep!

XtGCmOQGr8nxkVCS5XMVFA.review_text: Excellent! Good food, good prices. Haven't tried Boozy Bingo on Tuesday but it's probably great also.

4Xfeyf-yYN9MLx-jVW_5zg.review_text: Let me start off by saying I usually come here for the drinks my favorite being the American Julep but tonight decided to order dinner.   Taco Tuesday I have to say not a Mexican restaurant but hey why not try it out, yes please and thank you. Tacos were amazing fried fish nicely done, chicken great flavor, and pork wow nice and smoky.   I am a Chef in San Francisco and would I recommend this place? Yes for the drinks an the food, not too mention the staff is pretty on point with what you want and friendly...

JIk9k25--epOwgbuC3DOxQ.review_text: We had a bite and a drink on a fairly quiet Monday before a concert at the Regency.  Service was great.  The food was excellent: I had a fried chicken sandwich, my wife had po boy.  The drinks were also great.  I can see how it could get a bit noisy during games but it was very pleasant for our visit.

Nv8leU4KUK3of_nP8X4oRA.review_text: Good food, good drinks, good value and great service.  We shared the brisket and sweet potato plate, collard greens, and baked beans.  All were flavorful and tasty. And it was enough food for two people to eat and walk away very full.   Decent beer selection and the Manhattan we ordered was not only well made but about 4 bucks cheaper than a lot of bars in San Francisco.  Our waitress, Tiffany was fantastic and the epitome of grace under fire, as the joint was filled to capacity.  One thing to note: BB&R is an official "Michigan" bar where people (lots and lots of them) come to watch Michigan college teams on television.  Michigan is somewhere in the midwest and the evening we came to dine, it was packed with folks who seemed like they might be transplanted from there.  Judging from this crowd, Michigan alumni are largely people well out of college who wax nostalgically for their lost youth, drink as if they're pledging a frat, and have little spatial awareness.    Also, their sports teams may not be very good because, both games being televised the night we were there ended with Michigan teams being blown out.  In closing, we will DEFINITELY come back to BB&R. Just not when Michigan is playing.

_I62JinFrlF_S0mMhOg6RA.review_text: Southern, modern, comfort food.  It was pretty quiet for a Saturday night, so I was a little skeptical with the food. When you walk in, you're directly confronted by the bar (so innocent but all so tempting). Seating extends all the way to the back, and lighting is more on the dark side. Perhaps a good place to go on a date?  Anyway, the waiter recommended their infamous Maple Rye Old Fashioned. Bacon? Can't go wrong with bacon. Except the fact that my alcohol has bacon. I was not a fan, and forced myself to drink it while witholding my gag reflex. I personally do not recommend, but you gotta try everything once in life (especially if alcohol is involved).   But the food was good! 1. Fried okra First time I've had it. Dip it in their jalapeño aoli for extra calorie flavor. The okra wasn't mushy and slimy as expected in gumbo, so that was appetizing.  2. Grilled baby octopus. A little too fishy for my taste buds, but my friends liked it. Chopped squid with a pico de gallo salsa concoction. Get it if you want some seafood instead of anything fried or makes a moo, oink, or cluck sound.  3. BBQ chicken sandwich Nothing memorable. I believe it's fried chicken strips? I can't even remember. But you get to pick a side, and the BBQ beans are delicious. I'd eat that anytime.  4. Fried chicken Crisp, juicy, and moist. This dish takes a while to make but it's worth it. Big portion  They also have a variety of sauces for dipping. Major brownie points there. Service held up. Our waiter was nice and seemed like he actually cared about our visit.

e3HuKf_j-k9ar4b-t4CzAg.review_text: So far we have been in three different times since they opened and every time they have been out of what I ordered for my main entree so I had to revert to a second or even third choice. Major bummer. Also, how does a Southern food place run out of Mac & Cheese ? That seems like a No-No to me. All three of these visits did not take place at a strange time of day either. I can understand running out of something later in the night but at 4pm on a Sunday you kind of still need to have Mac & Cheese available (amongst other basics!). Seems like the kitchen needs to plan the food ordering/delivery a little better so as to not constantly be out of food. Of the three meals I have eaten here, everything has been on the salty side. I had meat items on 2 of the 3 visits and the meat was on the dry side both times. Asked for sauce on the side at all 3 visits and all 3 times my food was drenched in sauce. Scant amount of coleslaw on the pulled pork sandwich. Portions in general are on the smaller side but that is not an issue to me.  All that being said, I really like the venue! It's really great to have somewhere on Polk Street that serves food late (until 1am). Atmosphere is nice and dark - just the way I like it. TVs available for sports fans. They will be opening up the other rooms eventually and it will be quite a large place. The beer selection is really nice and if they ever get their own brewing deal up and running that should be a fun bonus. Hopefully with some more feedback and attention they can tune up some of these issues as it is a great spot for the neighborhood and something different to eat on Polk. I hope they work out the kinks and up the quality of food (and the quantity! It's nice to order something and have it available!). Perhaps pay a little more attention to the customer when he or she is placing the order. Can't say I'll be going out of my way to go back for the food after 3 average experiences but I would go for drinks again for sure. And maybe some appetizers (if they haven't run out!).

6_VkzelWeSHzjTVDlGl-Ug.review_text: DRINKS: Lotta beers  ATMOSPHERE: Pretty big and spacious for SF, lots of rooms, Not bad atmosphere. It's along Polk, so you can add that to your debauchery crawl up the street.   9.13.13

ZJlNrE2Z_i_-6IKeciRO7g.review_text: Not-quite-hipster bar at the end of the trendy section of Polk. It was quiet when we arrived, and the bartender put on a show mixing drinks, but it became very busy very rapidly.   Passable selection of beer, but nothing of note. They have food, but I didn't check for vegan offerings; looked like greasy bar food.   The 80s and 90s hip-hop was cool, but way too loud. Probably not a place I'd go again.

dE9YaRaUtkDm-xJrW3BSPg.review_text: not dingy, not overly cramped, not hipster, not in the mission.  so far so good.  reasonably priced creative drinks.  the one i tried was pretty good.  flat panel tvs for sports.  i like.

PgwqtZqWWqmoXnL2vzILYA.review_text: Worst bar experience I've ever had in San Francisco.  The bartenders Saturday night were extremely rude. I tried to order 8 shots, 3 whiskey based and 3 vodka based but I asked the bartender to dilute them with lemon juice or something sour, not sweet. And he laughs and says, honey, it's too busy of a night for you to not know what you want, I need something more specific. So I said just add some lemon juice to the shots and he laughs again and says we're too busy for that.  I am at a bar, did I get something wrong?? You should take pride in the drinks you make! Later, my friend closed out her tab and the card was declined and she said, how weird and asked him to try again and he said,  sorry, you're just broke. So rude!!! I was appalled and made a comment to a stranger about the bartender and he also had a bad experience. When he tried to close out his tab the bartender said he was too busy to close out tabs and he had to wait. The worst part is it wasn't even that busy!! we tried to go to the female bartender but she was also very rude; asked my friend where she was from and then just insulted her response.  Weird place and neither of the bartenders were nice. They made us feel unwelcomed and bad about ourselves. Why work in service if you hate people. I would never go back. The only nice person was the doorman and I feel bad that he has to deal with such terrible co-workers.

qcO-F1m-WViloT0xhcqkkQ.review_text: the smokey jalapeño margarita is TO DIE FOR.  i'm addicted and i don't even care!  the food is yummy, and the service is fast and friendly.  i love this place and am excited to watch it blossom and grow :)

ZN4jwp8KeMg2V6d7iMnWhw.review_text: Just tried this place for the first time tonight.  I am so excited this place is in my neighborhood! The vibe is great and really good for a romantic date night. The service was good and the prices were reasonable. The drinks were amazing! I had 2 rounds of the American Julep which I highly recommend. The other stand outs were the BBQ sausage, ribs, baked beans, and sweet potato fries. The bread pudding for desert was super tasty! Definitely going to come back

m84TDkgx0yr9Ckco6v6g1w.review_text: The BEST fried chicken EVER!!!!!  Great spicy sauces and drinks too!  Love this place and the owners are awesome - especially Shannon - she rocks!  Tennessee is pretty cool too :).

qIDy9zJfCuqxy6A3exPe_w.review_text: Next time I am trying food.  Met up for drinks at HH. All cocktails were $2 off which is decent for city prices. The bartender was also very nice while I was waiting for my friend to show up.   Slowly, the dining area was filled with people grubbing, and the lingering smell of barbecue. Yum.  It's a very cute, intimate place. The bar area has two flat screen TVs and rustic furniture.  I love that this bar is very close to my house and a breath of fresh air to the usual dingy Polk Street bars. I'll be back!

BYuR5Elf7EaJ88AdzYi26w.review_text: Sweet spot!! Definitely worth a visit, or a few.    Recs: Fried okra- douse their aioli with a little hot sauce I thought for jalapeño it was pretty tame, but the batter and okra were perfect Mac n cheese- really great!  I still have a place (i wont mention here) back home that is #1 for me on Mac, but this is really worth having a go at. Corn bread- if you like corn bread you wont be disappointed  Maple rye old fashion- nothing need be added  They are relatively new and still getting things going but are definitely on the right track.  I think their menu could use 1 or 2 more choices for entree but everything they do have sounded or looked good.
